org.forgerock.openam.cts

Class CTSPersistentStoreImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.cts.CTSPersistentStoreImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CTSPersistentStore

    @Singleton
public class CTSPersistentStoreImpl
extends Object
implements CTSPersistentStore
    Implementation of the CTS (Core Token Store) persistence layer. This implementation offers synchronous and asynchronous approaches to decouple callers from the processing of token related tasks. This is detailed in the CoreTokenAdapter in more detail.
    See Also:
    Token, CoreTokenAdapter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      CTSPersistentStoreImpl(CoreTokenAdapter adapter, Debug debug)
      Creates a default implementation of the CTSPersistentStoreImpl.

        public void createAsync(Token token)

        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore

        Throws:

      • read

        public Token read(String tokenId)
           throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Read a Token from the persistent store synchronously.
        Specified by:
        read in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenId - The non null Token Id that the Token was created with.
        Returns:
        Null if there was no matching Token. Otherwise a fully populated Token will be returned.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was an error while performing the different TokenBlobStrategys on the returned Token, or if the operation itself has failed.

      • update

        public void update(Token token)
            throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Updates an existing Token in the store synchronously. If the Token does not exist in the store then a Token is created. If the Token did exist in the store then it is updated. Not all fields of the Token can be updated, see the Token class for more details.
        Specified by:
        update in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        token - Non null Token to update.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was an error while performing the different TokenBlobStrategys on the provided Token, or if the operation itself has failed.
        See Also:
        Token.isFieldReadOnly(org.forgerock.openam.tokens.CoreTokenField)

      • delete

        public void delete(String tokenId)
            throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Delete the Token from the store synchronously based on its id. Note: It is often more efficient to delete the token based on the Id if you already have this information, rather than reading the Token first before removing it.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenId - The non null Token Id of the token to remove.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If the delete operation has failed.

      • delete

        public int delete(Map<CoreTokenField,Object> query)
           throws DeleteFailedException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Delete a collection of Tokens from the Token Store asynchronously using a filter to narrow down the Tokens to be deleted.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        query - Non null filters which will be combined logically using AND.
        Returns:
        total number of tokens deleted by query.
        Throws:
        DeleteFailedException

      • addContinuousQueryListener

        public void addContinuousQueryListener(ContinuousQueryListener listener,
                                       TokenFilter tokenFilter)
                                throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Performs a continuous query against the persistent store using the provided TokenFilter. The filter is assembled by the TokenFilterBuilder which provides the options on how to turn the query being performed. The filter is appropriate to the underlying persistent layer type. The continuous query will begin and the listener will be attached.
        Specified by:
        addContinuousQueryListener in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener which is capable of handling the results from this continuous query.
        tokenFilter - Non null filter.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was any error whilst performing the query.
        See Also:
        TokenFilter, TokenFilterBuilder

      • removeContinuousQueryListener

        public void removeContinuousQueryListener(ContinuousQueryListener listener,
                                          TokenFilter tokenFilter)
                                   throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Removes a ContinuousQueryListener from a specified TokenFilter.
        Specified by:
        removeContinuousQueryListener in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener which is already associated with a running continuous query.
        tokenFilter - Non null filter.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException
        See Also:
        TokenFilter, TokenFilterBuilder

      • stopContinuousQuery

        public void stopContinuousQuery(TokenFilter tokenFilter)
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Removes all ContinuousQueryListeners and stops a ContinuousQuery generated for a specified TokenFilter.
        Specified by:
        stopContinuousQuery in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter - Non null filter.
        See Also:
        ContinuousQueryListener, ContinuousQuery

      • query

        public Collection<Token> query(TokenFilter tokenFilter)
                        throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Performs a synchronous query against the persistent store using the provided TokenFilter. The filter is assembled by the TokenFilterBuilder which provides the options on how to turn the query being performed.
        Specified by:
        query in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter - Non null filter.
        Returns:
        Non null, but maybe empty.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was any error whilst performing the query.
        See Also:
        TokenFilter, TokenFilterBuilder

      • attributeQuery

        public Collection<PartialToken> attributeQuery(TokenFilter tokenFilter)
                                        throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Performs a partial Token query against the store synchronously. That is, a query which is aimed at specific attributes of a Token, rather than whole Tokens. The return result will consist of PartialTokens for this purpose. This function is useful for example, finding all Token IDs that match a certain criteria.
        Specified by:
        attributeQuery in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter - Non null TokenFilter, with the return attributes defined.
        Returns:
        Non null, but maybe empty.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was any error whilst performing the query.
        See Also:
        TokenFilter.addReturnAttribute(org.forgerock.openam.tokens.CoreTokenField), TokenFilterBuilder, PartialToken

      • deleteOnQueryAsync

        public void deleteOnQueryAsync(TokenFilter tokenFilter)
                        throws CoreTokenException
        Description copied from interface: CTSPersistentStore
        Performs an asynchronous query against the persistent store using the provided TokenFilter and then deletes the matching tokens from the store.
        Specified by:
        deleteOnQueryAsync in interface CTSPersistentStore
        Parameters:
        tokenFilter - Non null filter.
        Throws:
        CoreTokenException - If there was a problem queuing the task to be performed.
        See Also:
        TokenFilterBuilder
